description: Jindal was ultimately proven correct, as "No-Go" zones continue to emerge throughout the continent.
title: Exclusive- ‘Bobby Jindal Was Right’ On Muslim No-Go Zones
title_page: Exclusive– ‘Bobby Jindal Was Right’ On Muslim No-Go Zones | Breitbart
text:
Bobby Jindal, the Governor of Louisiana and a Republican candidate for President, has released a new video exclusively to Breitbart News, highlighting the attacks he received from the mainstream media when he warned against the presence of Muslim-supremacist “No-Go” zones in Europe.
Jindal was ultimately proven correct, as “No-Go” zones continue to emerge throughout the continent.
The video highlights the vicious attacks Jindal was subject to from mainstream media outlets such as CNN and MSNBC.
Jindal’s campaign video highlights a particular MSNBC segment on “Islamophobia In U.S,” when a Muslim commentator says in racist remarks: “Yeah, you know, I think, Governor Jindal is protesting a bit too much [about the No-Go zones]. He might be trying to, you know, scrub some of the brown off of his skin as he runs to the right, you know.”
“He should have his facts on this and he doesn’t,” one CNN Political Commentator said in his false assertion that Jindal was incorrect on the “No-Go” zones.
The clip plays video of Jindal from a recent speech where he said: “We have got to insist on assimilation. Make no mistake, Immigration without assimilation, that’s not immigration. Immigration without assimilation is invasion.”
“Bobby Jindal was right,” the video from the Governor’s campaign concludes.
As Breitbart Editor Joel Pollak wrote Monday, Jindal faced heavy criticism earlier in 2015 when he pointed out the dangers of the several Muslim “No-Go” zones emerging in Europe.
In fact, the French government has previously listed 750 areas determined as “Sensitive Urban Zones.”
The Swedish government, similarly, has listed 186 “exclusion areas,” described by a Swedish blogger as “crowded, predominantly Muslim immigrant ghettos, where education is low, employment is lower and the only local business thriving is drug dealings”
Belgium and the Netherlands also have several known areas that can be commonly referred to as “no-go” zones, which boast a large Islamic population where police often struggle to enforce the country’s laws.
Separately, Gov. Jindal issued an executive order on Monday, titled, “Protecting Louisiana Amid Obama Administration Plans For Resettlement of Syrian Refugees,” which blocks the resettlement of Syrian refugees into Louisiana. He also ordered the Louisiana State Police to monitor any Syrian refugees already in the state for national security-related reasons.
